meanings.definition: To disqualify oneself as a judge in a particular case.
meanings.sent1: The judge was recusing himself from the trial.
meanings.sent2: She decided to recuse herself from the conflict of interest.
meanings.sent3: The cat recused itself from the game of chase, claiming it was too tired.
meanings.sent4: The student recused himself from the debate, feeling unprepared.
meanings.sent5: Recusing from the race, the runner avoided a potential injury.

meanings.definition: To excuse oneself from a duty or obligation.
meanings.sent1: He was recusing himself from the task, citing a prior commitment.
meanings.sent2: She recused herself from the volunteer work due to illness.
meanings.sent3: The dog recused itself from guarding the house, opting to nap instead.
meanings.sent4: The employee recused himself from the meeting, needing to attend a family event.
meanings.sent5: Recusing from the cleanup, the child went to play outside.

meanings.definition: To withdraw from participation in a decision or action.
meanings.sent1: They were recusing themselves from the vote, feeling conflicted.
meanings.sent2: The team captain recused himself from the final play of the game.
meanings.sent3: The bird recused itself from the flock, choosing to explore alone.
meanings.sent4: The artist recused herself from the art show, focusing on personal projects.
meanings.sent5: Recusing from the project, the group missed out on valuable experience.
